intro: Siphocampylus weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
